title: Evaluation and Design for Magnetic Lens Thermal Management Systems Driven by a Layer of Graphite/Paraffin-Based Composite Phase Change Material
content: The art and science of magnetic electron lens design goes back to 1926 when BUSCH discovered electromagnetic fields utilized as lenses for electrons [1]. Conventional electromagnetic coil magnetic lenses have existed in condition to commercialize mass production throughout a century of evolution. Despite the crucial role of magnetic lens design in electron optics, the current commercial landscape is characterized by an oligopoly controlled by a few well-known companies [2]. However, several simulation software packages exist [3-7], which allow researchers to model and evaluate potential lens designs rapidly and inexpensively computationally. In this manuscript's scope, numerical simulation software capabilities have been thoroughly utilized. (here in a commercial code, COMSOL MultiphysicsÂ®).
